Paid_Value_Prop: $199/seat/month: Real-time agent coaching, QA automation, escalation prediction
Why_This_Score: LTV $4,800 (3% MoM churn), CAC $250 via outbound, clear 5x ROI from handle time reduction. Network effects: ticket data improves model for all customers. Attaches to critical workflow = high switching cost. Market: $9B CCaaS space. Risk: Zendesk/Intercom copy feature.

Why_This_Score: Scale AI charges $0.10-0.20/label. Your AI reduces cost 4x, human verification creates trust moat. LTV $15k+ (5% MoM churn), CAC $400 from ML teams. Data flywheel: more labels → better AI → more customers. Market: $7B and growing 30% YoY.

Why_This_Score: Consultants charge $30k-60k for SOC2. AI reduces to $299/mo = 100x cost disruption. LTV $9k (70% annual retention), CAC $180 via YC/Stripe Atlas partnerships. Regulatory moat: becomes audit standard. Market: $2B compliance SaaS. Risk: Vanta/Drata already funded.

Idea: AI Code Review & Security Audit Service
Paid_Value_Prop: $199/repo/month: Private repo deep scans, PR blocking, compliance reports (SOC2/ISO)
Why_This_Score: Devs hate security busywork. LTV $2,400 (8% MoM churn), CAC $120 via GitHub Marketplace. Network effects: every vulnerability reported improves model. Market: $4B DevSecOps. Risk: GitHub Copilot X will add this. Mitigation: Focus on compliance layer.

Paid_Value_Prop: $49/mo: Unlimited reviews, jurisdiction templates, payment escrow integration
Why_This_Score: ClearSave $200+/contract vs lawyer. LTV $588 (15% MoM churn), CAC $35 via Upwork/Fiverr. Regulatory arbitrage: "review" not legal advice. Market: $1.5B SMB contract mgmt. Risk: State bar crackdown. Low network effects but high pain point.

Support burden kills margins. LTV $12k (project basis), CAC $800 (sales team needed). AI code gen reduces dev time 30% but not defensible. Market: $12B low-code. Risk: Retool raises $45M, commoditizes custom dev. Lifestyle business at best.

Paid_Value_Prop: $10/mo: Commercial license, WAV downloads, stem access
Why_This_Score: YouTube RPM $1-3, affiliate RPM $5. LTV $45 (20% MoM churn), CAC $30 from organic. Market: $1B sleep apps but music licensing is race to zero. Risk: Spotify/Apple Music have infinite free ambient playlists. Commercial license market is <5% of users.

Paid_Value_Prop: $5/mo: Early access to new designs, premium fonts
Why_This_Score: POD margins 15-20% (Printful data). Affiliate commission 5% on $30 AOV = $1.50. LTV $24 (25% MoM churn), CAC $18 from Facebook ads. Market: $6B POD. Risk: Canva has 100M+ users and infinite free templates. "Early access" is weak value prop.

Paid_Value_Prop: $8/mo: Progress tracking, lesson plans, teacher dashboard
Why_This_Score: Teacher churn 25%/mo (annual retention 7%). LTV $32, CAC $45 via Facebook. Khan Academy free, Prodigy freemium with $180M revenue. You have zero brand trust. Market: $8B edtech. Reality: 80% of edtech startups fail; CAC > LTV within 6 months.

Paid_Value_Prop: $10/mo teacher license + 5% affiliate on printer filament
Why_This_Score: Teacher market is $300/year out-of-pocket (Dept of Ed data). Affiliate RPM $5 (Amazon cut commissions from 8% to 3% in 2023). LTV $21 (30% MoM churn), CAC $25 from Reddit ads. Market: $2B 3D printing materials. Thingiverse is free; MyMiniFactory already dominates.

Direct competitor: Khan Academy (free, $50M budget). Duolingo Math (free, $300M AI spend). Your CAC $50 vs their $0. LTV $36 (20% MoM churn). Market: $3B math edtech. Reality: Parents won't pay when world's best products are free.

Google "free worksheets" = 2B results. Teachers Pay Teachers has 7M users. Your affiliate RPM $8 max. LTV $18 (35% MoM churn), CAC $20 from Pinterest ads. Market: $1B worksheet market. Post-COVID saturation: 300+ competitors. Death by SEO.

Duolingo: $300M AI budget, 100M MAU, $180 ARPU, free. Your CAC $60 vs their $50. LTV $48 (18% MoM churn). Market: $8B language learning. Math: They spend 6x your total potential LTV per user on AI. You're roadkill.

Copyright law: translating books requires author permission (Berne Convention). LTV $28 (22% MoM churn), CAC $40 from parent ads. Market: $2B children's books. Competitors: Storyweaver (free, 50k books), Unite for Literacy (free). Legal quagmire + commodity = death.

Bundling two 1/10 ideas = 1/10. LTV $45 (25% MoM churn), CAC $65. Duolingo Stories + Math = free. You have $0 AI budget vs their $300M. No differentiation, double the dev cost. Market: Same $8B. This is zombie startup idea.

LTV $54 (25% MoM churn), CAC $75. Highest cost, lowest defensibility. Jack of all trades, master of none. When free competitors exist in each vertical, bundling is surrender. Burn rate 3x higher, same revenue. Guaranteed CAC > LTV within 4 months.

Free_Value_Prop: 200+ free web tools (calculators, converters, CRM helpers)
Why_This_Score: $0 CAC (SEO), $50k LTV enterprise, 90% margin. Pure service layer arbitrage. Real moat: client data integration. Risk: Overservicing free users.
Market saturated with 5M+ free files. Teachers budget $150/yr total—$10/mo is fantasy. Affiliate RPM $2-3. CAC $45, LTV $24. Money pit.
Duolingo ABC is free. Amazon Kindle Kids+ is $4.99/mo. CAC $60 in parent niche, LTV $28 (4-month churn). Regulatory: COPPA compliance costs $30k+. Zero defensibility.
Teachers Pay Teachers has 7M free + 3M paid at $1-5 each. Districts won't approve $120/yr for AI content. DMCA risk: 40% of AI worksheets infringe on trademarked characters. CAC $55, LTV $18.

YouTube/SoundCloud offer infinite free loops. Epidemic Sound has 200k human-made tracks at $15/mo. AI music has 0% copyright enforceability. CAC $35, LTV $12. Platform risk: Spotify can demonetize overnight.
PBS Kids, CoolMathGames, Code.org are free. Teacher IT departments block new domains. 15% of free users convert? No—0.3% is reality. CAC $70, LTV $16. Churn 35%/mo.

Score is generous. Duolingo spends $300M on AI; you spend $0. They have 500M users; you have SEO debt. Free→paid is 0.5% max. CAC $80 (language niche is gold rush), LTV $36. Impossible unit economics.
Khan Academy is free forever. Photomath is free + ads. Prodigy charges $10/mo but burned $200M to get there. Math content has 0.2% conversion. CAC $65, LTV $13.50. Literal waste of time.
Combining two failing ideas doesn't make one working idea. Same CAC, same churn, same free alternatives. This is the "peanut butter and arsenic" strategy.

Printful offers free designs. Canva is $15/mo for everything. Redbubble has 50M free designs. Early access isn't a value prop—it's a meme. CAC $30, LTV $9. Amazon Merch On Demand is free and gives you Prime placement.
Duolingo Max is $30/mo with GPT-4 tutoring. You're charging $15 for AI content with zero brand. This is like opening a burger stand across from McDonald's with a "come back tomorrow for fries" sign.

The triple-down on failure. Critical math: To hit $10M ARR, you need 46,296 subscribers at $18/mo. With 0.5% conversion, you need 9.2M free users. Education content CAC is $70. That's $644M in ad spend. This is mathematically impossible.
$0 CAC via IRS 990 data scraping. LTV $8,970 (30-mo retention). 10x cost reduction vs $3k/consultant. Moat: proprietary grant success data. Risk: 501(c)(3) budget cycles are slow.
